intro: Crinum aurantiacum, commonly known as the orange lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking orange-red flowers with a strong, spicy fragrance. The plant has strap-like, narrow leaves that are often tinged with purple at the base. Its bulbous root system is typical of the Amaryllidaceae family, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Crinum aurantiacum is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
